description: The CodeBoarding system orchestrates a comprehensive code analysis and documentation generation workflow. It begins with the Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager initializing projects, managing code repositories, and detecting changes. This orchestrator leverages the Incremental Analysis Engine to optimize performance by caching and re-analyzing only modified code. The core intelligence resides in the LLM Agent Core, which uses large language models to interpret code and analysis results. The agent interacts with the codebase and static analysis data through the Agent Tooling Interface, which in turn queries the Static Code Analyzer for deep structural and behavioral insights. Finally, the LLM Agent's findings are passed to the Documentation & Diagram Generator to produce user-friendly documentation and visual architectural diagrams.

components.name: Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager
components.description: Manages the overall application lifecycle, including project initialization, repository operations (cloning, updating), change detection, and orchestrating the analysis workflow. It also handles the initial setup and environment configuration for the analysis tools.

components.name: Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager
components.description: Manages the overall application lifecycle, including project initialization, repository operations (cloning, updating), change detection, and orchestrating the analysis workflow. It also handles the initial setup and environment configuration for the analysis tools. This component acts as the central coordinator, initiating and managing the sequence of operations.

components.name: Configuration Manager
components.description: Centralizes the management and retrieval of application‑wide configuration settings. Provides default configurations and allows for dynamic updates, ensuring consistent behavior across all components, including LLM providers, analysis tools, and output formats.

components.name: Installation & Environment Setup
components.description: Ensures necessary external tools, binaries (e.g., npm, JDTLS, VCPP redistributable), and language-specific environments are correctly installed and configured for static analysis and other operations. Updates static analysis configurations, acting as a critical prerequisite for a multi-language code analysis tool.

components.name: Monitoring & Telemetry System
components.description: Collects, processes, and persists runtime metrics, focusing on LLM usage, tool execution, and overall run statistics. Provides execution context and utilities for tracing and monitoring various parts of the system, essential for tracking performance, cost, and usage of LLM interactions and other tools.

components.name: Analysis Data Model
components.description: Defines standardized data structures for representing code analysis results, including metadata, components, relations, and a unified analysis JSON format. Facilitates consistent data exchange between different stages of the analysis and generation pipeline.

components.name: Analysis Processing & Documentation Generator
components.description: Takes structured analysis data (conforming to the Analysis Data Model), processes it further (e.g., assigning IDs, extracting specific details), and transforms it into human‑readable documentation, typically in markdown format. This component implements the documentation generation aspect of the project.

components.name: Job Database
components.description: Stores and manages the state and metadata of ongoing or completed analysis jobs using DuckDB. Provides CRUD operations for job information, enabling persistence and retrieval, supporting service‑oriented and pipeline architectures.

components.name: System Health & VSCode Integration
components.description: Monitors the system's operational health, sets up logging, and provides integration points and configuration management specifically for a VS Code extension, enhancing the user experience within the IDE.

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The intelligent core responsible for driving the code analysis and documentation generation using large language models. It orchestrates agent workflows, manages interactions with various tools, and structures the analysis insights.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Primary coordinator of the entire code analysis and documentation generation workflow, managing operation sequencing, invoking specialized agents, integrating outputs, and overseeing pipeline state.

components.name: Prompt Generator
components.description: Dynamically generates and manages context‑specific prompts for various LLMs and analysis tasks, ensuring precise instructions for effective code interpretation.

components.name: Prompt Orchestrator
components.description: Dynamically selects and manages LLM‑specific prompt factories, providing a central interface for retrieving tailored prompts for various analysis tasks. It acts as the entry point for the system to obtain the correct prompt based on the target LLM.

components.name: LLM‑Specific Prompt Template Repository
components.description: Manages a collection of predefined prompt templates, each specifically designed and formatted for different Large Language Models, ensuring optimal interaction and performance. This component encapsulates the actual prompt content and its LLM‑specific structure.

components.name: LLM Configuration Manager
components.description: Handles configuration, initialization, and management of different LLMs, storing API keys, model names, temperature settings, and provider‑specific parameters.

components.name: LLM Configuration Data Model & Access
components.description: Defines the canonical data model for LLM configurations, manages secure storage and retrieval of API keys, resolves additional parameters, and determines the active status of LLM configurations, acting as the single source of truth for all LLM‑related settings.

components.name: LLM Instance Provisioner
components.description: Orchestrates the creation and instantiation of diverse LLM instances (generic chat models, agent‑specific LLMs, parsing‑focused LLMs) by consuming configuration data, selecting the appropriate chat class or LLM implementation, and building concrete, usable LLM objects.

components.name: Specialized Analysis Agents
components.description: Collection of distinct agents (Metadata, Abstraction, Details) each focused on a specific phase or type of code analysis, leveraging LLMs to extract domain‑specific insights.

components.name: CodeBoarding Orchestrator
components.description: Central control unit that initiates and manages the entire code analysis workflow, classifies files, dispatches tasks to specialized agents, and coordinates the overall process.

components.name: Abstraction Agent
components.description: Generates high-level summaries and conceptual groupings from code, receiving tasks from the Orchestrator and producing abstract representations of code structures and functionalities.

components.name: Details Agent
components.description: Performs granular analysis of specific code segments or clusters, extracting fine-grained insights and detailed information under the direction of the Orchestrator.

components.name: Metadata Agent
components.description: Extracts and interprets project-level metadata such as project type, domain, technology stack, and architectural patterns, providing essential contextual information.

components.name: Response Parser
components.description: Utility component that interprets and standardizes structured responses from LLMs or external APIs, transforming raw outputs into usable data formats for the Orchestrator and agents.

components.name: Analysis Planning Engine
components.description: Strategically determines the optimal plan and sequence for the analysis workflow, deciding which code entities need deeper investigation based on current insights and goals.

components.name: Analysis Planner Agent
components.description: Core component of the Analysis Planning Engine that strategically determines the optimal plan and sequence for the analysis workflow, deciding which code entities need deeper investigation based on current insights and goals. It orchestrates tasks, interacts with other engines, and monitors progress.

components.name: Analysis Data Models
components.description: Defines canonical data structures and schemas for representing analysis results, intermediate states, and architectural insights, ensuring consistent data exchange across the subsystem.

components.name: Analysis Data Models (ADM)
components.description: Defines canonical data structures and schemas for representing analysis results, intermediate states, and architectural insights, ensuring consistent data exchange across the subsystem.

components.name: LLM Response Formatter (LRF)
components.description: Converts structured analysis data into human‑readable or LLM‑consumable string formats. Manages representation of CFG‑specific components and clusters, ensuring complex data can be communicated to AI agents or documentation.

components.name: LLM Base Utilities (LBU)
components.description: Provides foundational utilities for interacting with LLMs, including a base model for LLM responses and mechanisms for extracting relevant strings.

components.name: Source Code Reference Manager (SCRM)
components.description: Manages references to specific parts of source code (file paths, line numbers) enabling agents to point to relevant snippets.

components.name: Component ID Service (CIS)
components.description: Ensures unique identification and tracking of components by providing functions for assigning and hashing component IDs.

components.name: Analysis Validation Engine
components.description: Performs comprehensive validation of generated analysis results, checking consistency, completeness, and correctness, including cluster coverage and component relationship integrity.

components.name: Validation Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the overall validation workflow, coordinating different validation checks and aggregating their results. It acts as the entry point for initiating validation processes.

components.name: Consistency Validator
components.description: Checks for logical consistency across various analysis artifacts, ensuring that different views or representations of the codebase do not contradict each other.

components.name: Completeness Validator
components.description: Verifies that all expected elements, relationships, or coverage metrics are present in the analysis results, identifying any missing information.

components.name: Relationship Integrity Validator
components.description: Focuses on validating the correctness and integrity of identified component relationships, ensuring they are well-formed and accurately reflect the codebase's structure.

components.name: Result Aggregator/Reporter
components.description: Collects the outcomes from individual validation checks, compiles a comprehensive validation report, and potentially flags critical issues.

components.name: Cluster Utilities
components.description: Provides reusable utility functions for manipulating and processing clusters of code entities, supporting assignment, representation building, and data integrity maintenance.

components.name: Clustering Orchestrator
components.description: Orchestrates the overall process of defining, refining, and managing code clusters. Provides high-level control over cluster creation, validation, representation, ensures uniqueness of assignments and entities, sanitizes identifiers, and manages the lifecycle of clusters.

components.name: File-to-Component Mapper
components.description: Manages the concrete assignment of individual source code files to specific code components or clusters, linking physical file structure to logical component organization and ensuring consistency and accuracy.

components.name: Static Code Analyzer
components.description: Performs deep structural and behavioral analysis of the codebase across multiple programming languages. It extracts information like call graphs, code structure, and identifies code quality issues, including unused code.

components.name: StaticAnalysisEngine
components.description: Orchestrates the entire static analysis process, coordinating code retrieval, call graph construction, quality checks, and aggregation of findings.

components.name: Static Analysis Core Engine (SA Core)
components.description: Orchestrates the overall static analysis process, serving as the central hub for initiating analysis, managing language-specific scanners, and integrating with incremental analysis. It provides core static analysis configurations and constants.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Orchestrator (IAO)
components.description: Optimizes static analysis by performing incremental updates. It manages caching of analysis results, detects code changes, and intelligently re-analyzes only affected parts of the codebase, also handling mapping and merging of cluster results.

components.name: Language Project Scanners (LPS)
components.description: Specializes in understanding project structure and build configurations for different languages (Java, TypeScript). It identifies relevant source files and project settings.

components.name: Language & Tooling Support (LTS)
components.description: Provides foundational support for various programming languages, defining language properties, managing LSP server configurations, and offering language-specific utilities such as JDK detection and command creation.

components.name: Git Change Analyzer (GCA)
components.description: Interacts with the Git version control system to identify code changes between commits or uncommitted modifications. It supplies the necessary input for incremental analysis to focus on modified files.

components.name: Health Check Runner (HCR)
components.description: Central component for executing and managing code health checks. It orchestrates the running of individual checks, aggregates their findings, and applies project-defined exclusion patterns to filter results.

components.name: Code Health Checks (CHC)
components.description: Collection of specialized modules, each implementing a specific code quality or architectural health check (unused code, God classes, cohesion, inheritance, coupling, instability, function size, circular dependencies).

components.name: Health Configuration & Models (HCM)
components.description: Manages configuration settings for all health checks, including thresholds and ignore rules, and defines data structures (models) used to represent health findings, summaries, and overall reports.

consults for project context related to changed files
uses for language-specific parsing and build tool integration
retrieves configuration settings and utilizes data models from
uses for check-specific configurations and to format their findings

components.name: LSPClient
components.description: Communicates with Language Server Protocol servers to extract language‑specific structural information such as ASTs, symbol definitions, and references.

components.name: LSP Client Core
components.description: Provides the foundational Language Server Protocol (LSP) communication layer. It manages the connection lifecycle with LSP servers, handles generic LSP requests, responses, and notifications, and offers core functionalities for querying code elements such as symbols, definitions, references, and call hierarchies.

components.name: Java LSP Client
components.description: Specializes the LSP Client Core for Java language servers. It supplies Java-specific initialization parameters, loads Java projects, and tailors communication for Java code analysis.

components.name: TypeScript LSP Client
components.description: Specializes the LSP Client Core for TypeScript/JavaScript language servers. It handles TypeScript-specific project bootstrapping, configuration, and communication.

components.name: Java Project Configuration Scanner
components.description: Scans the codebase for Java build configurations (Maven, Gradle, Eclipse, etc.) and extracts project structure information. This data is required by the Java LSP Client to correctly initialise its workspace.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Coordinates the overall static-analysis workflow. It identifies source files, prepares them for analysis, and triggers specific analysis tasks by invoking the appropriate LSP client.

components.name: LSP Diagnostic Data Model
components.description: Defines structured data types and utilities for representing, parsing, and managing diagnostic information (errors, warnings, suggestions) received from language servers.

components.name: CallGraphBuilder
components.description: Constructs and maintains the call graph of the analyzed codebase by processing structural and semantic information obtained from the LSPClient.

components.name: CallGraphBuilder
components.description: Orchestrates the construction of the call graph by integrating structural and semantic information obtained from various sources, such as LSP clients and language‑specific configurators. It populates the core graph data structure.

components.name: Call Graph Management
components.description: Provides the foundational data structure for the call graph, offering interfaces for adding nodes and edges, querying graph elements, and initiating graph‑wide operations like clustering. It serves as the central repository for the graph's state.

components.name: Java Project Configurator
components.description: Specializes in scanning Java projects to identify build systems (e.g., Maven, Gradle) and extract configuration details, providing language‑specific context for accurate call graph construction.

components.name: Code Reference Resolver
components.description: Normalizes and resolves code references across the codebase, ensuring that all links within the call graph are accurate and consistent regardless of their original format or location.

components.name: Graph Clustering Engine
components.description: Applies algorithms to group related nodes within the call graph, transforming the detailed, raw graph into a more abstract and manageable representation for documentation and visualization.

components.name: Clustering Result Accessor
components.description: Offers a standardized interface for retrieving and interpreting the outcomes of the graph clustering process, enabling access by file, cluster ID, or other criteria.

components.name: UnusedCodeAnalyzer
components.description: Identifies and reports code elements that are defined but never invoked or referenced, leveraging the call graph and structural information.

components.name: Java Project Scanner
components.description: Discovers Java projects (Maven, Gradle, Eclipse) in a given directory, identifies project roots, and initiates creation of project-specific configuration objects.

components.name: Java Project Configuration
components.description: Encapsulates configuration details for a single Java project, parsing build files (pom.xml, build.gradle) to extract dependencies, source directories, and other metadata required for analysis.

components.name: StaticAnalysisResults
components.description: Acts as a data repository for all outputs generated during static analysis, storing call graphs, code structures, and analyzer findings.

components.name: Analysis Result Manager
components.description: Acts as the central repository and orchestrator for all static analysis outcomes, managing artifacts such as CFGs, class hierarchies, package dependencies, code references, and source file information. It coordinates the overall analysis data flow.

components.name: Analysis Data Cache
components.description: Provides a caching mechanism for static analysis results, storing and retrieving previously computed data to avoid redundant computation.

components.name: Source File Provider
components.description: Supplies utilities to discover and retrieve source files within a project, feeding file lists to the Analysis Result Manager for further processing.

components.name: Java Project Configuration Scanner
components.description: Scans and parses Java project configuration files (e.g., Maven pom.xml, Gradle build.gradle, Eclipse .project) to understand project structure, dependencies, and build settings.

components.name: Java Project Configuration Model
components.description: A data model encapsulating parsed configuration details of a single Java project, providing structured access to information like dependencies, source directories, and build specifics.

components_relations.relation: submits call graph and code structures to

components.name: Agent Tooling Interface
components.description: Provides a set of specialized tools that allow the LLM Agent Core to interact with the codebase, query static analysis results, and perform specific actions within the project context.

components.name: Agent Tooling Interface
components.description: Primary facade for the LLM Agent Core, aggregating and exposing all code analysis and interaction tools. It orchestrates and delegates requests from the agent to the appropriate specialized tools.

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit
components.description: The central orchestrator and entry point for the Agent Tooling Interface. It aggregates various code analysis capabilities and delegates agent requests to the appropriate specialized tools, managing their lifecycle and coordinating their outputs.

components.name: CodeReferenceReader
components.description: Specializes in parsing code references (e.g., fully qualified names) and extracting specific source code snippets or definitions from the codebase. It translates high‑level references into concrete code segments for analysis.

components.name: ExternalDepsTool
components.description: Responsible for identifying and summarizing external software dependencies by scanning project manifests, configuration files, and build scripts. It provides an overview of the project's external ecosystem.

components.name: ReadFileTool
components.description: Provides direct access to the file system, allowing for the retrieval of raw file content based on a given file path. It acts as a low‑level interface for reading source files.

components.name: GetCFGTool
components.description: Generates and retrieves Control Flow Graphs (CFGs) for specified code units (e.g., functions, methods). This tool is essential for understanding the execution paths and logical flow within the code.

components.name: CodeStructureTool
components.description: Analyzes the codebase to extract and present its structural organization, including class hierarchies, module relationships, function signatures, and other high‑level architectural elements.

components.name: BaseRepoTool
components.description: Offers foundational repository utilities, including context management, caching mechanisms for file system operations, and methods for traversing the project directory structure. It serves as a common backend for other tools requiring repository access.

components.name: File System Interaction Tool (ReadFileTool)
components.description: Specialized tool that enables the LLM Agent Core to read specific file contents from the repository, providing direct access to source code. It serves as an interface to the underlying File System Interaction Layer.

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The intelligent core responsible for interpreting user queries, planning actions, and making decisions on what information to retrieve or analyze. It orchestrates the use of various tools, including ReadFileTool.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Manages the workflow and execution of tasks across different components, ensuring that operations are performed in the correct sequence and that data flows appropriately.

components.name: File System Interaction Tool (ReadFileTool)
components.description: Specialized tool that enables the LLM Agent Core to read specific file contents from the repository, providing direct access to source code. It serves as an interface to the underlying File System Interaction Layer.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: The underlying layer responsible for abstracting and managing access to code repositories. It handles the actual file system operations.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: A component dedicated to performing in-depth analysis of source code to extract structural information, identify patterns, and detect potential issues without executing the code.

components.name: CFG Analysis Tool (GetCFGTool)
components.description: Tool that provides the LLM Agent Core with the capability to query and retrieve Control Flow Graph (CFG) data, offering insights into execution paths and program logic. It acts as an interface to the CFG Analysis Engine.

components.name: CodeReferenceReader
components.description: Retrieves raw source code content from various references (files, modules, specific lines). It serves as the foundational data access layer for static analysis, providing the raw text needed for further processing by other analysis tools.

components.name: GetCFGTool
components.description: Generates Control Flow Graphs (CFGs) for specified code components, abstracting execution flow into a graphical representation. This tool is crucial for understanding program logic and potential execution paths without actual execution.

components.name: MethodInvocationsTool
components.description: Identifies and reports method invocation instances across the codebase, mapping call hierarchies and dependencies. It provides insights into how different parts of the code interact, complementing CFG analysis by detailing inter-component communication.

components.name: Code Structure Analysis Tool (CodeStructureTool)
components.description: Allows the LLM Agent Core to access high‑level code structure information, such as class hierarchies, package relationships, and source snippets. It interfaces with the Code Structure Analysis Engine.

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The primary consumer of code structure analysis. It initiates requests for structural information to understand the codebase and inform its decision-making processes.

components.name: Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the workflow of code analysis requests. It determines which tools to invoke, in what sequence, and aggregates their outputs to fulfill the LLM Agent Core's requests.

components.name: FileStructureTool
components.description: Provides a hierarchical tree view of the project's directory structure, respecting specified depth limits and ignore patterns. Essential for initial project exploration and locating relevant files.

components.name: PackageRelationsTool
components.description: Analyzes and presents high-level package-level dependencies, offering an architectural map of the codebase. Provides essential architectural context beyond individual files.

components.name: CodeReferenceReader
components.description: Resolves fully-qualified code references and retrieves the corresponding source code snippets. Primary mechanism for obtaining raw code for other analysis tools.

components.name: CodeStructureTool
components.description: Inspects a given class (identified by its fully-qualified name) and extracts detailed structural information, including inheritance hierarchy, methods, and attributes.

components.name: ReadDocsTool
components.description: Extracts content from documentation files based on supplied paths and line ranges. Supports the LLM by providing human-written context.

components_relations.relation: supplies package dependency data to Orchestrator
provides source code snippets to Orchestrator
furnishes detailed structural data to Orchestrator

components.name: File System Interaction Layer
components.description: Provides raw, low‑level access to the repository, including reading file contents, traversing directory structures, and handling file‑related operations. It is the foundational layer for accessing source code.

components.name: Control Flow Graph (CFG) Analysis Engine
components.description: Core engine responsible for generating, processing, and querying control flow graphs and method invocation data. It performs detailed static analysis of execution paths and program logic.

components.name: Code Structure Analysis Engine
components.description: Engine that interprets and extracts high‑level code structure, including source snippets, external dependencies, package relationships, and class hierarchies. It provides the structural understanding of the codebase.

components.name: Repository Context Manager (BaseRepoTool)
components.description: Supplies shared utilities such as file caching, .gitignore handling, and path resolution. It ensures consistent and optimized repository interaction across all analysis components, acting as a foundational service.

components.name: BaseRepoTool
components.description: Core repository context manager that provides file caching, .gitignore filtering, and normalized path resolution for all analysis components.

components.name: FileCache
components.description: Utility that stores and retrieves file contents to reduce redundant I/O and speed up repository interactions.

components.name: GitignoreHandler
components.description: Parses .gitignore files and provides filtering logic to exclude irrelevant paths from analysis.

components.name: ReadDiffTool
components.description: Tool that extends BaseRepoTool to read and parse git diff output, exposing structured change information for incremental analysis.

components.name: CodeReferenceReader
components.description: Component that resolves abstract code references to concrete file paths and returns raw source code strings for downstream processing.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Engine
components.description: Optimizes analysis performance by managing the caching of static analysis results and orchestrating re-analysis only for changed parts of the codebase, ensuring efficiency and speed.

components.name: IncrementalUpdater
components.description: Acts as the central orchestrator for the incremental analysis process, coordinating change detection, cache interactions, and targeted re-analysis of modified code sections.

components.name: Incremental Update Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central orchestrator for the incremental analysis process, coordinating change detection, cache interactions, and targeted re-analysis of modified code sections. It determines the overall strategy for an update.

components.name: Analysis Data Store
components.description: Manages persistence and retrieval of analysis results and manifest data, handling loading previous states and saving updates to enable incremental processing. It acts as the system's memory for past analysis.

components.name: File Change Manager
components.description: Identifies, categorizes, and manages file changes (additions, deletions, renames) within components, ensuring correct assignment of new files and removal of deleted ones from analysis scope.

components.name: Impact & State Analyzer
components.description: Assesses the impact of code changes on component structure and relationships, determining affected components and required update actions (patch, re-analyze, full re-analysis). It also evaluates the nature of changes to decide if incremental patching is possible or if a full re-expansion is required.

components.name: Analysis Execution Engine
components.description: Executes targeted analysis for specific impacted components or subgraphs when full re-expansion is unnecessary, and manages full re-analysis of components that cannot be incrementally updated, orchestrating re-execution of the analysis pipeline.

components.name: Path Patching Processor
components.description: Updates file paths within analysis results and manifest to reflect renames or moves, ensuring consistency after structural codebase changes.

components.name: Incremental Models & Constants
components.description: Defines data structures, enums (e.g., ChangeImpact, UpdateAction), and constants used across the subsystem, providing a common language and configuration.

components.name: Incremental Validation
components.description: Validates the integrity and correctness of the incremental update process and its generated results, ensuring analysis remains accurate and consistent.

components_relations.relation: applies modifications to data managed by

components.name: AnalysisCache
components.description: Persistently stores and retrieves static analysis results, preventing re-computation on unchanged code and supporting performance optimization.

components.name: Analysis Cache
components.description: Persistently stores and retrieves static analysis results, preventing re-computation on unchanged code and supporting performance optimization.

components.name: Analysis Cache Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of the Analysis Cache. It handles serialization and deserialization of complex analysis objects, orchestrates their storage into and retrieval from the Analysis Cache, and implements cache invalidation strategies.

components.name: Incremental Update Engine
components.description: Orchestrates the process of detecting code changes, assessing their impact, and triggering selective re-analysis or updates. It relies on the Analysis Cache Manager to fetch existing analysis data and store new or updated results.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: The core component responsible for performing deep analysis of source code to extract structural, semantic, and behavioral information. It produces raw analysis artifacts that are then consumed by other components for storage or further processing.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Manages access to the project's source code repositories. It handles fetching code, tracking file changes, and providing the necessary code context to the analysis components.

components.name: Output Generation Engine
components.description: Transforms the analysis results into various user-consumable formats, such as interactive diagrams (e.g., Mermaid.js), documentation, or reports. It is the final step in presenting the insights derived from the code analysis.

components.name: ClusterChangeAnalyzer
components.description: Identifies and analyzes logical code clusters that have been modified, providing precise information on which parts require re-analysis.

components.name: IncrementalUpdater
components.description: Orchestrates the overall incremental update process for diagram analysis. It identifies affected components, applies necessary changes, and ensures that only modified parts trigger re-analysis, optimizing performance.

components.name: ClusterChangeAnalyzer
components.description: The core engine for detecting, classifying, and quantifying structural changes within logical code clusters. It analyzes differences between code versions and identifies the nature of modifications.

components.name: ClusterChangeResult
components.description: A data transfer object (DTO) that encapsulates the outcome of a cluster change analysis. It contains information such as matched clusters, classified changes, and associated quantitative metrics.

components.name: ChangeMetrics
components.description: Responsible for calculating specific quantitative metrics related to code changes, such as node movement ratios. These metrics provide numerical insights into the extent and type of modifications.

components.name: Documentation & Diagram Generator
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data and insights into user-friendly documentation formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML) and generates visual representations like architectural diagrams.

components.name: CLI & Orchestration Engine
components.description: Serves as the primary interface and control center for the tool. It handles command-line argument parsing, environment variable validation, and orchestrates the entire workflow, from initiating repository processing to triggering analysis and output generation.

components.name: Analysis Core Engine
components.description: Executes static code analysis, builds file coverage data, and generates detailed analysis results. It interprets code structure, relationships, and handles incremental updates to the analysis data.

components.name: Analysis Data Store/Manifest Management
components.description: Manages the persistent state and metadata of the analysis. It stores the manifest and file coverage information, providing mechanisms for loading, saving, and updating these critical analysis results.

components.name: Output Generation & Formatting
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data into various user‑friendly documentation formats (HTML, Markdown, MDX, reStructuredText). This component integrates templating capabilities to ensure consistent styling and structure across all generated outputs, encapsulating all format‑specific generators and the common templating engine.

components.name: GitHub Action Integration
components.description: Provides specific entry points and orchestration logic tailored for execution within GitHub Actions CI/CD pipelines. It handles loading existing analyses and triggering documentation generation within an automated workflow context.
